Package common

Interface DatabaseSource

All Known Implementing Classes:
NetworkConnection
public interface DatabaseSource
The interface class used to interact with the database specified by the client.
Author:
Alistair Ridge, Johnny Madigan and Scott Peachey

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addAsset​(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String desc)
    Method used to add an asset to the database
    void addAssetToUnit​(java.lang.String unitname, int balance, int assetID, int assetqty)
    Add an existing asset from the database to a unit
    void addOrder​(Order order)
    Method used to add an order to the orders table in the database
    void addUnit​(java.lang.String orgName, int balance)
    * Method used to add an Organisation to the database
    void addUser​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password, boolean access)
    Method used to add a user to the User table in the database As methods should be single-purposed, the user will be added to a unit in the usersUnit() method
    void addUser​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String unit, boolean access)
    Method used to add a user to the database but using POLYMORPHISM (method overloading) Like the method above, this method explicitly defines a user's unit when adding to the database
    void adjustAssetQuantity​(java.lang.String unitName, int assetID, int qty)
    Changes the quantity of an asset held by a unit
    void adjustBalance​(java.lang.String unitname, int amount)
    Method used to update the local instance of the OrgUnit object.
    void cancelOrder​(Order order)
    Method used to cancel/remove a specified order in the orders table in the database
    void changePassword​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
    Method used by any logged in user to change their own password in the database.
    java.util.ArrayList<Asset> getAllAssets()
    Method used to get a list of all asset types held in the database

    Method to get a list of all units currently in the database
    java.util.ArrayList<User> getAllUsers()
    Method to get a list of users currently in the database

    Method used to get a specified asset from the database

    Method used to get outstanding orders of a certain asset from the orders Database

    Method used to get outstanding orders from the orders Database

    Method used to get the data for an Organisation from the database

    Method used to get a units outstanding orders from the orders Database

    Method used to get a list of all assets held by an Organisation

    Method used to get the data for a specified user from the database

    Method used by admins to update a user's access in the database.
    void updateUsersUnit​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String unit)
    * Method used by admins to update a user's unit in the database.

  • Method Details

    • login

      User login​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password) throws DoesNotExist, IllegalString
      Method used when a user attempts to log in. Uses the username to get the user from the database, then hash the input password with that user's salt to see if there's a match.
      Parameters:
      username - username input
      password - password input
      Returns:
      the user object for the log-in session
      Throws:
      DoesNotExist - Throw an exception if the user does not exist
      IllegalString - Throw an exception if the password is not a valid string

    • getUser

      User getUser​(java.lang.String name) throws DoesNotExist
      Method used to get the data for a specified user from the database
      Parameters:
      name - username of user to get
      Returns:
      a User object that holds all the users data
      Throws:
      DoesNotExist - Throw an exception if the user does not exist

    • addUser

      void addUser​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password, boolean access) throws IllegalString, AlreadyExists
      Method used to add a user to the User table in the database As methods should be single-purposed, the user will be added to a unit in the usersUnit() method
      Parameters:
      username - user's unique username
      password - password the user will use to login
      access - admin access for the user
      Throws:
      IllegalString - Throw an exception if the password is not a valid string
      AlreadyExists - Throw an exception if the user already exists

    • addUser

      void addUser​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String unit, boolean access) throws IllegalString, AlreadyExists
      Method used to add a user to the database but using POLYMORPHISM (method overloading) Like the method above, this method explicitly defines a user's unit when adding to the database
      Parameters:
      username - User's unique username
      password - Password the user will use to login
      unit - The unit that the user belongs to
      access - Admin access for the user
      Throws:
      IllegalString - Throw an exception if the password is not a valid string
      AlreadyExists - Throw an exception if the user already exists

    • removeUser

      void removeUser​(java.lang.String username)
      Method to remove a user's data from the database
      Parameters:
      username - user to delete

    • getAllUsers

      java.util.ArrayList<User> getAllUsers()
      Method to get a list of users currently in the database
      Returns:
      usernames

    • changePassword

      void changePassword​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password) throws DoesNotExist, IllegalString
      Method used by any logged in user to change their own password in the database. The same method will be used for admins to change any user's password in the database.
      Parameters:
      username - username of the user's password to change
      password - password we want to change it to
      Throws:
      DoesNotExist - Throw an exception if the user does not exist
      IllegalString - Throw an exception if the password is not a valid string

    • updateUsersUnit

      void updateUsersUnit​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String unit) throws DoesNotExist
      * Method used by admins to update a user's unit in the database.
      Parameters:
      username - username of the user's unit to change
      unit - unit we want to change it to
      Throws:
      DoesNotExist - Throw exception if the user does not exist

    • removeUserUnit

      void removeUserUnit​(java.lang.String username)
      Method used by admins to remove a user's from their unit in the database.
      Parameters:
      username - username of the user's unit to change

    • updateUsersAccess

      void updateUsersAccess​(java.lang.String username, boolean access)
      Method used by admins to update a user's access in the database.
      Parameters:
      username - username of the user's access to change
      access - access we want to change it to

    • addOrder

      void addOrder​(Order order) throws OrderException, DoesNotExist
      Method used to add an order to the orders table in the database
      Parameters:
      order - The order that is being placed
      Throws:
      OrderException - Throw exception if there is an issue with the order
      DoesNotExist - Throw exception if the order details (e.g. unit or asset) do not exist

    • getOrders

      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​Order> getOrders()
      Method used to get outstanding orders from the orders Database
      Returns:
      A list of outstanding orders

    • getUnitOrders

      java.util.ArrayList<Order> getUnitOrders​(Unit unit)
      Method used to get a units outstanding orders from the orders Database
      Parameters:
      unit - The unit that's orders are being collected
      Returns:
      Array list containing the unit's outstanding orders

    • getAssetOrders

      java.util.ArrayList<Order> getAssetOrders​(Asset asset)
      Method used to get outstanding orders of a certain asset from the orders Database
      Parameters:
      asset - The asset that's orders are being collected
      Returns:
      Array list containing the outstanding orders involving a given asset

    • reconcileOrder

      void reconcileOrder​(Order order)
      Method used to move an order to the order history table in the database and remove it from the order table
      Parameters:
      order - The order that is being reconciled

    • cancelOrder

      void cancelOrder​(Order order)
      Method used to cancel/remove a specified order in the orders table in the database
      Parameters:
      order - The order that is being cancelled

    • getUnitOrderHistory

      java.util.ArrayList<Order> getUnitOrderHistory​(Unit unit)
      Method used to get a list of outstanding orders for a specified unit
      Parameters:
      unit - Unit to get a list of outstanding orders for
      Returns:
      A list of outstanding orders

    • getUnit

      Unit getUnit​(java.lang.String unitID) throws DoesNotExist
      Method used to get the data for an Organisation from the database
      Parameters:
      unitID - The id for the Organisation
      Returns:
      an OrgUnit object that holds all the organisations data.
      Throws:
      DoesNotExist - Throw exception if the unit does not exist

    • addUnit

      void addUnit​(java.lang.String orgName, int balance) throws IllegalString, AlreadyExists
      * Method used to add an Organisation to the database
      Parameters:
      orgName - The unit that is being added to the database
      balance - The initial balance of the unit
      Throws:
      IllegalString - Throw exception if the unit name is not a valid string
      AlreadyExists - Throw exception if unit already exists

    • removeUnit

      void removeUnit​(java.lang.String unitname)
      Method used to remove an Organisation from the database
      Parameters:
      unitname - the Unit that is being removed

    • adjustBalance

      void adjustBalance​(java.lang.String unitname, int amount)
      Method used to update the local instance of the OrgUnit object. This is used to update the organisations list of assets, asset qty, users, and the amount of credits the organisation holds.
      Parameters:
      unitname - Name of the unit that's balance is being adjusted
      amount - Amount to adjust the units balance by

    • adjustAssetQuantity

      void adjustAssetQuantity​(java.lang.String unitName, int assetID, int qty)
      Changes the quantity of an asset held by a unit
      Parameters:
      unitName - the unit to have their asset quantity changed
      assetID - the asset in question
      qty - the new quantity

    • addAssetToUnit

      void addAssetToUnit​(java.lang.String unitname, int balance, int assetID, int assetqty) throws AlreadyExists, DoesNotExist
      Add an existing asset from the database to a unit
      Parameters:
      unitname - the unit to add an asset to
      balance - the units new credit balance
      assetID - the asset which will be added to the unit
      assetqty - the quantity of the asset
      Throws:
      AlreadyExists - if the asset is already held by the unit
      DoesNotExist - if the asset does not exist

    • removeAssetFromUnit

      void removeAssetFromUnit​(java.lang.String unitname, int assetID)
      Remove a currently held asset from a unit
      Parameters:
      unitname - the unit to remove the asset from
      assetID - the asset to be removed

    • getAllUnits

      java.util.ArrayList<Unit> getAllUnits()
      Method to get a list of all units currently in the database
      Returns:
      ArrayList of Unit objects

    • getUnitsAssets

      java.util.HashMap<Asset,​java.lang.Integer> getUnitsAssets​(Unit unit)
      Method used to get a list of all assets held by an Organisation
      Parameters:
      unit - The organisation to retrieve a list of assets for
      Returns:
      A TreeMap of asset objects with their quantity values

    • getAsset

      Asset getAsset​(int assetID)
      Method used to get a specified asset from the database
      Parameters:
      assetID - ID of the asset to retrieve from the database.
      Returns:
      An Asset object containing all the relevant historical data

    • getAllAssets

      java.util.ArrayList<Asset> getAllAssets()
      Method used to get a list of all asset types held in the database
      Returns:
      An array list of all assets held in the Database

    • addAsset

      void addAsset​(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String desc) throws AlreadyExists
      Method used to add an asset to the database
      Parameters:
      id - ID of the asset that is being added
      desc - Description of the asset that is being added
      Throws:
      AlreadyExists - Exception thrown of the asset already exists in the database

    • removeAsset

      void removeAsset​(java.lang.String id)
      Method used to remove an asset from the database
      Parameters:
      id - ID of the asset to remove from the database

    • updateAssetDesc

      void updateAssetDesc​(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String desc) throws AlreadyExists
      Updates an existing assets description
      Parameters:
      id - the asset ID to update
      desc - the new description
      Throws:
      AlreadyExists - if the new description is the same as the original
